intro: Lilaeopsis occidentalis, commonly known as the western lily. It is a flowering plant native to the western United States, characterized by its delicate, grass-like foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or meadow habitats. Its botanical features include narrow leaves and a flowering stem that bears several small, clustered blooms. Lilaeopsis occidentalis is a member of the Iridaceae family, which includes irises and related genera.
